Interests: Our research subject is strongly correlated quantum matter and we are fascinated by emergent behavior of the quantum matter. We wish to understand the role of many-body interactions and/or disorder on the electronic strucutre of materials. Materials of particular interest to us are carbon based systems such as carbon nano-tubes, graphene, graphite and diamond. Intrigued by the beauty and spectacular properties of Dirac fermions in graphene, we are also investigating three dimensional Dirac materials and their topologically non-trivial relatives. Given that the Dirac materials already at the single-particle level display fascinating properties, we wish to explore the role of strong correlations and/or disorder in these systems. The interaction of radiation field with quantum states of matter in general and Dirac materials or strongly correlated quantum matter is another subject we wish to learn about. In our weekly group meetings we discuss the above subjects. As part of our efforts to catch up with the latest developments in condensed matter we organize weekly seminars on strongly correlated systems in collaboration with Prof. Abdollah Langari of SUT. We also have a separate advanced study program within our team to read and discuss advanced books or review articles in our field of research.
